# PWA Setup Guide

## ‚úÖ PWA Implementation Complete

The application is now a fully functional Progressive Web App (PWA) with the following features:

## üéØ Features Implemented

### 1. **PWA Manifest** (`/public/manifest.json`)
- App name and short name
- Theme colors (cyan: #06b6d4)
- Display mode: standalone
- Icons for all sizes (192x192, 512x512)
- Maskable icons for Android
- App shortcuts
- Categories: productivity, utilities

### 2. **Service Worker** (Auto-generated by vite-plugin-pwa)
- Automatic caching of static assets
- Runtime caching for:
  - **CDN Resources** (unpkg.com) - 30 days cache
  - **Google Fonts** - 1 year cache
  - **API Calls** - 5 minutes cache with NetworkFirst strategy
- Offline support
- Auto-update on new versions

### 3. **Install Prompt**
- Custom hook: `usePWAInstall` 
- Install button in menu (when installable)
- "App Installed" indicator in menu
- Handles beforeinstallprompt event
- Detects if already running as PWA

### 4. **PWA Meta Tags** (`index.html`)
- Theme color
- Apple mobile web app capable
- Apple touch icons
- Manifest link
- Proper viewport settings

## üì± Installation

### Desktop (Chrome, Edge, Brave)
1. Open the app in browser
2. Click the 3-dot menu (top-right)
3. Click "Install App" button (with download icon)
4. App will install and open in standalone window

### Mobile (Android)
1. Open the app in Chrome/Edge
2. Tap browser menu
3. Tap "Install App" or "Add to Home Screen"
4. App icon will appear on home screen

### Mobile (iOS Safari)
1. Open the app in Safari
2. Tap Share button
3. Tap "Add to Home Screen"
4. App icon will appear on home screen

## üîß Configuration

### PWA Config in `vite.config.js`:
```javascript
VitePWA({
  registerType: 'autoUpdate',
  workbox: {
    globPatterns: ['**/*.{js,css,html,ico,png,svg,woff,woff2}'],
    runtimeCaching: [...]
  },
  devOptions: {
    enabled: true  // PWA works in dev mode too!
  }
})
```

### Manifest in `public/manifest.json`:
- App metadata
- Icon definitions
- Theme colors
- Display mode
- Shortcuts

## üöÄ Build & Deploy

### Development
```bash
npm run dev
```
PWA features work in development mode!

### Production Build
```bash
npm run build
```
Generates:
- `dist/` folder with optimized assets
- `dist/sw.js` - Service worker
- `dist/workbox-*.js` - Workbox runtime
- `dist/manifest.webmanifest` - Web manifest

### Preview Production Build
```bash
npm run preview
```

## üì¶ Assets Required

Create these icon files in `/public/`:
- `pwa-192x192.png` - 192x192px icon
- `pwa-512x512.png` - 512x512px icon

Optional screenshots:
- `screenshot-wide.png` - 1280x720px (desktop)
- `screenshot-narrow.png` - 750x1334px (mobile)

## üé® Theme Colors

- **Primary**: #06b6d4 (cyan)
- **Background**: #ffffff (white)
- **Dark Mode**: Auto-detected from app

## ‚ú® Features

### Offline Support
- App works offline after first visit
- Cached resources load instantly
- API calls use NetworkFirst strategy

### Auto-Updates
- New versions detected automatically
- Service worker updates in background
- Users get latest version on refresh

### App-like Experience
- No browser UI in standalone mode
- Full screen experience
- Proper app icon on device
- Smooth transitions

### Install Detection
- Detects if app is already installed
- Shows install button only when needed
- Displays "App Installed" indicator
- Handles standalone display mode

## üõ†Ô∏è Development

### Test PWA Features
1. Build the app: `npm run build`
2. Preview: `npm run preview`
3. Open in browser
4. Test install prompt
5. Test offline mode (DevTools > Network > Offline)

### Debug Service Worker
1. Open DevTools (F12)
2. Go to Application tab
3. Click "Service Workers"
4. See registration status
5. Test "Update on reload" and "Bypass for network"

### Check Manifest
1. DevTools > Application > Manifest
2. Verify all properties
3. Test "Add to homescreen"

## üìä PWA Score

Use Lighthouse to check PWA score:
1. Open DevTools (F12)
2. Go to Lighthouse tab
3. Select "Progressive Web App"
4. Click "Generate report"
5. Should score 100/100!

## üîê HTTPS Required

PWA requires HTTPS in production:
- ‚úÖ Localhost (development)
- ‚úÖ Vercel (auto HTTPS)
- ‚úÖ Netlify (auto HTTPS)
- ‚ùå HTTP sites (won't work)

## üì± Browser Support

- ‚úÖ Chrome (Desktop & Mobile)
- ‚úÖ Edge (Desktop & Mobile)
- ‚úÖ Samsung Internet
- ‚úÖ Safari (iOS 11.3+)
- ‚úÖ Firefox (limited install support)
- ‚úÖ Opera

## üéØ Next Steps

1. **Create Icons**: Generate 192x192 and 512x512 PNG icons
2. **Test Install**: Try installing on different devices
3. **Test Offline**: Verify app works offline
4. **Deploy**: Push to Vercel/Netlify

## üìù Notes

- Service worker updates automatically
- Clear cache if needed: DevTools > Application > Clear storage
- PWA works in development mode for testing
- Install prompt shows only once per session
- iOS has some PWA limitations (no push notifications)

## üêõ Troubleshooting

### Install button doesn't show
- Check if already installed
- Try incognito/private mode
- Verify HTTPS connection
- Check browser console for errors

### Service worker not registering
- Check browser console
- Verify `sw.js` exists in dist
- Clear browser cache
- Rebuild the app

### Offline mode not working
- Wait for first load (assets need to cache)
- Check service worker is active
- Verify cache strategy in config
- Test with DevTools offline mode
